hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid, regarding the words of Allah: 'And it obeyed its Lord and it was obligated' - He said: It heard for its Lord and obeyed, and as for His saying 'and it was obligated', He means: It was obligated for it to do so

narrators.name: Abd al-Rahman
reliabilityIssues: Unknown exact identity of this Abd al-Rahman

narrators.name: Ibrahim
narrators.full_name: Ibrahim ibn Fuhd al-Basri or similar

narrators.name: Waraqah
narrators.full_name: Waraqah ibn Umar or possibly another Waraqah

narrators.name: Ibn Abi Nujayh
narrators.full_name: Zaid ibn Abi Unaysah (Ibn Abi Nujayh)
reliabilityIssues: Uses 'an (عَنْ) which can indicate indirect transmission
Known to have some confusion in narrations

potential_issues.issue: Chain is mawquf (attributed to Mujahid, a tabi'i) - does not reach the Prophet ﷺ
potential_issues.impact: This is a tafsir report from a tabi'i, not a marfu' hadith. Its authority depends on Mujahid's reliability and the chain's integrity

potential_issues.issue: Abd al-Rahman at the beginning is not definitively identified
potential_issues.impact: Uncertainty about the reliability of the first narrator makes overall chain assessment more cautious

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Aisha: I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saying: 'Whoever is questioned will be tormented.' So I said: Does not Allah say 'So he will be questioned with an easy questioning'? So he said: O Aisha, that is the presentation, but whoever is closely questioned about the account will be tormented

narrators.name: Ibrahim
narrators.full_name: Ibrahim ibn Fuhd al-Basri or similar

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Mix of transmission terms - some direct (ثنا/نا) and some indirect (عَنْ)

potential_issues.issue: Ibrahim uses 'qala' (قَالَ) which indicates reported speech rather than direct narration
potential_issues.impact: Slight ambiguity in the connection between Ibrahim and Adam

potential_issues.issue: The first two narrators (Abd al-Rahman and Ibrahim) lack clear biographical information
potential_issues.impact: Makes it difficult to assess their reliability with certainty

Topics: Dialogue between Aisha and the Prophet ﷺ about the Day of Judgment

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid, regarding the words of Allah: 'And the moon when it becomes complete' - meaning: When it becomes full. Also narrated by Abd al-Rahman, who said: Ibrahim narrated to us, Adam narrated to us, Shayban narrated to us, from Mansur, from Mujahid, similar (to the first chain)
